Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that all speed cameras on the M1 and M25 motorways were simultaneously activated with a uniform speed limit of 72 miles per hour.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that all speed cameras were activated with a uniform speed limit of 72 miles per hour.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there was a mischievous intent behind the warning, suggesting that the misinformation was intentionally spread.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the spread of the viral message was due to confusion and misinformation, rather than intentional deception.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there was no uniform change in the deployment of speed cameras on the M1 and M25 motorways in January 2019.
Understate: The claim understates the complexity of speed limits on major roads, including variable limits that can change in real time based on various factors.
